meanings.definition: A photograph taken quickly and informally.
meanings.sent1: I love looking at old snapshots of my family.
meanings.sent2: She took a few snapshots at the party to capture the fun moments.
meanings.sent3: The snapshots from the camping trip made us all laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a collection of snapshots, each one vivid and clear.
meanings.sent5: The snapshots on the wall told the story of their travels.

meanings.sent1: Can you give me a quick snapshot of the meeting?
meanings.sent2: The report provided a helpful snapshot of the company's financial status.
meanings.sent3: His explanation was like a snapshot, short and to the point.
meanings.sent4: The snapshot of the book gave me a good idea of what to expect.
meanings.sent5: The snapshot of the news highlighted the main events of the day.

meanings.sent1: The snapshot of the city skyline was breathtaking.
meanings.sent2: As the train passed by, I caught a quick snapshot of the countryside.
meanings.sent3: His words painted a vivid snapshot of the situation.
meanings.sent4: The snapshot of the sunset lingered in her mind long after.
meanings.sent5: The snapshot of the storm approaching was both beautiful and ominous.
